citations.narrative:
Two hamster cages, out of approximately 25 enclosures, were observed to have too many hamsters within. The
enclosures measured 12 inches by 18 inches and contained 31 and 40 hamsters respectively with an average weight of
20 grams. In enclosures that size, for each hamster to have adequate required 10 square inches of minimum floor space,
there could be no more than 20 in each enclosure. Primary enclosures shall be constructed and maintained so as to
provide sufficient space for each hamster contained therein to make normal postural adjustments with adequate freedom
of movement. Hamsters must be sorted, and moved to separate enclosures when necessary to ensure they have
sufficient space for normal postural adjustments and freedom of movement.
Correct by: 6/19/2025

There was an accumulation of old feces, feed pellets and dirt within 4 of the of the 25 enclosures containing hamsters.
The owner reported he had not been able to adequately clean the enclosures for the last few days. Primary enclosures
shall be cleaned often enough to prevent an accumulation of excreta or debris.
Correct by: 6/19/2025

During the inspection 4 dead hamsters were first identified by the inspector in four different cages. Each of the dead
hamsters had multiple wounds with visible dried blood. The wounds were consistent with trauma that could be inflicted
from cage mates. The facility reported the enclosures were male only enclosures and they had not been sorting recently.
The facility employee stated that this is a common occurrence that results from animals picking on one another and
therefore the facility is not effectively assessing compatibility. Traumatic injury of animals by cage mates, especially when
it occurs repeatedly, is an indicator that the animals are not compatible and should be quickly identified by the facility to
prevent the fatal outcomes observed. Correct by ensuring that only compatible animals are housed together.
Correct by: 6/19/2025
This is a continuation of the report for the routine inspection conducted 6/11/2025 and contains the remaining non-
compliances found during the inspection. The exit briefing for the items included on this report was conducted on
6/11/2025.
This inspection was conducted with the Licensee on 6/11/2025. The exit interview were conducted with the Licensee on
6/11/2025.
